intro: Riedlea depressa, commonly known as the depressed riedlea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in lowland forests and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
